pros:
Strong mobbing potential
  • Also has strong 5th Job Skills that boost its mobbing potential even further
Good mobility in Hawk stance and Leopard Stance
cons:
Complex Skill Tree mechanic
  • You also cannot max all Skill Trees

One of Beast Tamer's main buff skill is RNG dependent
  • Meow Card and more specifically Meow Gold Card which applies effects of all 3 cards
Not a KMS class, thus does not receive many changes and has many bugs
Difficult bossing against mobile bosses, your main bossing attack is stationary

Some important skills do not have 5th Job Boost Nodes
  • Ex. Majestic Trumpet, Fort Follow-Up, and Bro Attack

info: Beast Tamer character creation only occurs for a limited time. Beast Tamer character creations are normally announced for major updates and can happen several times a year

build: Max priority order - Bear > Cat > Hawk
Max priority order - Leopard > Bear > Choice of Hawk or Cat
details: Beast Tamer unlocks new skills as you reach higher levels and allocate enough SP into that tree
You will have only enough SP to max two skill trees and a partial third tree
Put one SP into each skill first that is available
For any skills that have prerequisites, follow them first before following build path
Some of Beast Tamer's skills will require Mastery Books to reach Master Level

hyperBuild.recommended:
• Furious Strikes - Reinforce, Extra Strike and Boss Rush
  • Formation Attack - Reinforce and Spread

If investing in Leopard Mode instead of Hawk Mode or training for Legion Effect / Link skill

  • Three-Point Pounce - Extra Strike and Reinforce

extraContent.title: Fort, Lai, Eka, and Arby
extraContent.content:
Beast Tamers do not have regular 1st, 2nd, 3rd, and 4th Job Advancements. Instead they 4 different animal stances with their own separate skill trees. The skills can only be used while in that specified stance. There is a Bear stance, Leopard stance, Hawk stance, and Cat stance. Hawk stance and Cat stance are unlocked as you level up. Cat stance, in particular, is a supportive stance that provides useful party buffs and heals

Additionally, Skills are unlocked at a specified level and require a set amount of Skill Points to be allocated into that Animal skill tree. You will not be able to max out all your skills. Instead, you will only have enough SP to max two animal skill trees and some remaining for a third tree. Additionally, any skill effects such as passives and actives are only granted while in that particular animal stance

Click this button in the Skill UI to show the expanded Skill Tree

primary.desc: Double jump skill
details: Can be assigned a Key Slot or activated by pressing jump twice

primary.desc: Allows you to change between each animal stance

details: Skill Level gradually increases as your character levels up

primary.desc: Removes certain abnormal status effects and become immune to Abnormal Status for a few seconds
Swipes forward 3 times consecutively
Releases a lethal gas that leaves a lingering burning field
Inhales pulling in enemies in front of you
Every 4th attack, you deal an additional attack
Continuously slam hammers in front of you
details: Activates when pressing Attack Key 4 times in a row
To keep Furious Strikes going, you can hold onto or mash the Attack Key

primary.desc: Inhales pulling in enemies on both sides of you
details: Skill is separate from

primary.desc: Summons Li'l Fort to attack at a fixed location
Swings a giant fish that damages nearby enemies
When hit by a fatal attack, you will be revived
details: When revive activates, knock back and damage nearby enemies
You are briefly invincible after reviving
Increased %Damage
Additionally grants flat Magic Attack

primary.desc: Flips a table in front of you damaging nearby enemies
Swipes forward 2 times
Swipes and dashes forward
details:
Can be linked with:
  • Leopard's Paw
  • Leopard's Pounce
  • Leopard's Roar
  • Macho Slam
  • Three-Point Pounce
Maximum of 10% Max HP can be restored per attack

primary.desc: Pounces forward
details:
Automatically activated when pressing Attack Key 3 times in a row
  • Can also be activated manually by pressing the Skill Key after the 2nd attack

primary.desc: Swipes up into the air launching yourself up
Pounces back down towards the ground
details: Can only be used in the air

primary.desc: While active, grants a chance for your attacks to summon a baby Snow Leopard to attack alongside you
Roars forward sending out a damaging shockwave
details: Automatically activated when pressing Attack Key after
Increases %Damage and max number of enemies hit for and

primary.desc: Leaves a damaging burning field after using
Releases a mighty roar that has a chance to stun enemies after using
details: [Passive]: Increases %Damage and max number of enemies hit for and

primary.desc: Pounces around 3 times while slashing at enemies

details: Increases %Damage and dash distance
Reduces cooldown

primary.desc: Unleashes a deadly slash that damages a large area
When Attack Key is held, fires out homing birds
details: When the birds hit an enemy, the cooldown of Fly is reduced slightly
You can move while casting

primary.desc: Increases the jump distance of and allows you to jump an extra time
Launches yourself up into the air
details: Can also be activated by double-tapping the Up Arrow Key while in the air

primary.desc: Creates a portal that leads to the nearest town for your party members
details: To use, press the Up Arrow Key
[Passive]: Permanently increases %Crit Damage

primary.desc: Allows you to fly which unlocks additional attacks
details: Press and hold the Jump Key and Up Arrow Key to fly
Press the Jump Key and Down Arrow Key to stop flying

primary.desc: While in , birds periodically spawn and attack nearby enemies
While in the air, holding the Skill Key will allow you to glide
Summons any party members on the same channel to your location
details: Characters have to be above Lv. 9
[Passive]: Increases %Ignore DEF

primary.desc: Grants flat Magic Attack and causes your attacks to apply a damaging bleeding debuff
While in , commands birds to slash around you, damaging nearby enemies
While in , creates a tornado that damages nearby enemies
details: You can control the tornado by using the Arrow Keys, similar to Sentient Arrow

primary.desc: Swings your sword upwards launching enemies into the air
details:
Follow-up Attacks occur when you press the same button consecutively, for example
  • Follow-up Attacks share the same key as its Active Attack

primary.desc: Swing your sword downward bring any enemies in the air back down

details: Increased %Damage

Now causes an exploding shockwave where attack landed
  • Unaffected by Damage Reflect

primary.desc: Swings your sword forward dealing damage to enemies
Throw your sword forward at an angle towards the ground

details: Increased %Damage

Instead of throwing your weapon at an angle, the sword will now slowly travel forward damaging and pushing enemies back
  • Unaffected by Damage Reflect

primary.desc: Twirl your sword while pulling enemies in
Continuously spin around dealing damage to enemies in the area
details: You can move while spinning
Attack is cancelled when another attack is used
Increased %Damage
Attack will also pull in nearby enemies

primary.desc: Slams down on the ground hitting nearby enemies
Jump upwards and slam down again hitting nearby enemies
Jump upwards a final time to slam a gigantic sword onto enemies

details: Increased %Damage
Now creates a lingering Shock Field that continuously damages to enemies within it

primary.desc: Beta's attacks has a chance to apply a stacking debuff that reduces an enemy's DEF
After being hit by an attack, there is a chance to generate a barrier that blocks damage
details: You are invincible at the time the barrier is created

primary.desc: Beta's attacks have a chance to apply a debuff that binds enemies and makes them more vulnerable to Alpha's attacks
details: Enemy is binded and Alpha's attack gain %Crit Rate and %Crit Damage towards that enemy
There is a cooldown (35 secs) before an enemy can be binded again using Critical Bind

[When Active]: Increases %Final Damage, %Ignore DEF, Attack Speed (by 1 stage) and %Elemental Resistance and grants flat Magic Attack
  • also gains additional hits per attack
  • However, you have reduced Recovery Amount and can only hit one enemy
[When Inactive]: You gain increased %Damage

hyperActive.desc: Damages nearby enemies while granting a buff to nearby party members
details: [Buff]: Protects allies from one KO
After receiving a Heaven's Door's buff, you may not receive another one for a short amount of time

fifthMain.name: Chrono Break
fifthMain.shortDesc:
Time Force Cost: 50, Max Enemies Hit: 15, Damage: 775%, Number of Attacks: 5, Bind Duration: 10 sec
Bind Duration: Increases up to 100%, based on initial damage done
For 42 sec - Skill Cooldowns: -250% (Excludes skills not affected by cooldown reduction), Attack Speed: +2, Final Damage: +35%, slows nearby enemies.
If any enemies still live when the skill ends, 20% of your damage from the skill will be inflicted upon them 15 times.
Cooldown: 240 sec.
fifthMain.desc: Unleashes a massive attack that binds nearby enemies
details: While active, nearby enemies are slowed, Skills have reduced cooldowns and you gain increased Attack Speed (by 2 stages), %Final Damage
If any enemies still live when the skill ends, they will take damage again based on the damage you did during Chrono Break
Unaffected by Attack Ignore and Damage Reflect

fifthMain.name: Twin Blades of Time
fifthMain.shortDesc:
Time Force Cost: 80, Max Enemies Hit: 12, Invulnerable while casting skill
[Beta Link] 1st Hit: Deals 1750% damage 8 times, 2nd Hit: Deals 1660% damage 12 times, 3rd Hit: Deals 2000% damage 13 times
[Alpha Link] 1st Hit: Deals 1750% damage 8 times, 2nd Hit: Deals 1660% damage 12 times, 3rd Hit: deal 2000% damage 13 times
[Joint Attack]: Triggers an explosion 3 time(s), which deals 1800% damage 15 times, Ignores an additional 100% Monster DEF
Cooldown: 120 sec
fifthMain.desc: Performs a joint attack with Alpha and Beta
details: Invincible while casting
Final attack has 100% Ignore DEF

fifthMain.name: Shadow Flash
fifthMain.shortDesc:
Time Force Cost: 10, creates a sanctuary that lasts during cooldown. Max Enemies Hit: 8
Alpha: Deals Damage: 1000%, Number of Attacks: 6. Beta: Deals Damage: 1200%, Number of Attacks: 5
Skill Cooldown: Consumes 25 Time Force to destroy the sanctuary, move to the location, and attack up to 15 enemies. Alpha: Activates a sword attack 3 time(s), Damage: 800%, Number of Attacks: 15. Beta: Activates a sword attack 2 time(s). Damage: 1500%, Number of Attacks: 12
Cooldown: 40 sec
fifthMain.desc: Creates a sanctuary on the ground that you can teleport back to destroy the sanctuary and deal a devastating attack
details: Alpha and Beta's Shadow Flash function separately

fifthMain.name: Ego Weapon
fifthMain.shortDesc: Alpha: Lazuli forms 9 blade(s), attacking 6 time(s) for 350% damage\nBeta: Lapis forms 3 Heavy Swords, unleashing 2 shock(s) for 350% damage to 4 enemies\nCooldown: 15 sec
fifthMain.desc: Periodically, additional attacks will appear for both Alpha and Beta while attacking
details: [Alpha]: Swords spin towards enemies dealing damage to enemies it collides with until it reaches the target
[Beta]: Swords strike down onto enemies dealing damage to surrounding enemies
Unaffected by Damage Reflect
Cooldowns are separate for Alpha and Beta

meta: Beast Tamer is an INT mage class part of its own Beast Tamer class group. What is special about Beast Tamers is that they do not have regular 1st, 2nd, 3rd, and 4th Job Advancements. Instead they 4 different animal stances with their own separate skill trees. The skills can only be used while in that specified stance. There is a Bear stance, Leopard stance, Hawk stance, and Cat stance
